content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="http://mrdata.usgs.gov/laterite/laterite.xsl"?><record id="4"><agegrp>b</agegrp><dep10km>low-sulfide quartz-Au veins</dep10km><cogrd>0.08</cogrd><coregrd>0.04</coregrd><cotogrd>0.04</cotogrd><comments>The deposit represents a \ufffd\ufffdblind discovery\ufffd\ufffd of structurally controlled laterite mineralization under alluvial cover. Feasibility study was completed in 1996 including estimated 48 Mt measured and indicated resource (see numbers in ReserveTonnage). Lateritic Ni higher grades are controlled by shear zone dipping at ~45\ufffd\ufffd NW.  78% of mineralization is composed of limonitic oxide ore.</comments><country>Australia</country><cntrycd>AUWA</cntrycd><deparea>21</deparea><deplength>18</deplength><depshape>discontinuous blanket along strike of faulted source
